reviews.review_text: Locks you out and will not accept your serial number if you have to re-install the game. I had a HD crash and had to re-install all my Steam games on the new drive. Customer support for this game ignores you and does not answer communications. The web site for this indicates re-installs are not permitted and the game MUST be re-purchased. Not only is this a violation of Steam TOS but it is also fraud, total sham!

I also needed to re-enter the install key ... but one email to Aerofly support and a new key was generated, and off I went. Don't let something as trivial as this change your mind about a rock solid PC flight simulation experience.

High quality graphics and very smooth keyboard controls make this an excellent flight sim. The detail on the aircraft itself is impressive, ranging from seeing the steering components actually move to minimal, but visible, damage on the airplane. Landing and taking off is simplified.  The biggest issue I have with Aerofly is the quality of the environment. Clouds are not highly detailed and the ground is very barren. The occasional cluster of buildings you might fly over (or through), are the 'large cities,' while the rest of the landscape has nothing besides Google Earth-like textures. The mountains are nicely done though.  Overall, if you are looking for an easy to pick up, quick to learn flight sim, it's hard to do better than Aerofly FS, but if you are looking for a serious, challenging, realistic flight simulator, look elsewhere, such as MS flight sim. It will entertain you, but not really challenge you.

This is a good game for those who love planes, but it is far from being a good simulator. The cockpits have lots of detail, but there is a lack of interaction with them. Also the ground graphics are very repetitive. You will get tired of this game after 2 hours.
Beautiful flights on different planes. In the hard mode is very close to reality. It is especially difficult to perform tasks for gliders. I recommend lovers to fly airplanes and gliders.

Fun for about an hour or two and that's about it. It's quite basic and the map size is literally the Swiss Alps only. I thought (before purchasing) that this was a true flight sim with an entire World size map to fly in. Nope. And the controls are quite basic and they are not many key functions to customize. I am a bit disappointed with all of the positive reviews of this. I had considered not buying this but I read a few of the nice reviews and thought (why not give it a go). But now after playing it hopefully I can get my money back because I believe those positive reviews to be fake and misleading. Unless you have no idea about flight-sims, STAY AWAY from this one!
